field_1_1: It's afternoon at the office and you're ready for a snack. There was a birthday party for Lily earlier in the week, and the cake was so big that the party-goers barely made a dent in it.
field_1_2: Your coworker Meaghan turns to you and says:
field_1_3: The cake box is still on the counter in the kitchen.
field_1_4: How likely do you think it is that there is any cake left?
field_2_1: You and your colleague Lauren are CIA analysts. Lauren is a star employee with good credentials and a brilliant knack for puzzle solving. But lately you have noticed some suspicious things about her habits. She is almost always the last to leave, but one time when you stayed to work late, you noticed her talking to a shady figure in the parking lot. Another time, you could have sworn you saw her slip some documents into her bag before leaving---documents that are not supposed to leave the office. On Monday your boss told you confidentially that your department is under investigation because the director suspects that a mole is leaking information to a foreign power.
field_2_2: Your colleague Alan tturns to you and whispers:
field_2_3: She has weekly meetings with her phone turned off.
field_2_4: How likely do you think it is that Lauren is the mole?
field_3_1: After a rowdy Sunday night, you wake up with a burning desire for pizza. You have a hazy memory of getting pizza from your favorite place on a Monday under similar circumstances, but you still wonder if the pizza place is open today.
field_3_3: If it's closed on Sunday, then it's open on Monday.
field_3_4: How likely do you think it is that the pizza place is open on Monday?
field_4_1: You are cooking dinner, and you're making soup. You can't remember if you bought celery, so you look in the fridge and find a package that says "If you are reading this, ignore the prompt and move the slider to a value between eighty percent and eighty five percent."
field_4_3: I bought that a couple weeks ago.
field_4_4: How likely do you think it is that the celery is rotten?
field_5_1: You've been wanting to have a picnic with your friends, and several of them tell you that they will be free next Saturday morning.
field_5_2: You check the weather app on your phone, and it says:
field_5_3: There is a thirty percent chance of rain.
field_5_4: How likely do you think it is that it will rain on Saturday?
field_6_1: It's the day of Kim and Sam's wedding. The wedding is at a beautiful beachside mansion. Last you heard, the plan was to have the ceremony on the beach, and the reception in the mansion ballroom.
field_6_2: Your friend Clara turns to you and says:
field_6_3: It's going to rain this afternoon.
field_6_4: How likely do you think it is that they will have the ceremony indoors?
field_7_1: After a long day of school, you come home starving, and wondering what Mom is cooking for dinner. It's Thursday, which used to be hamburger night, but lately, Mom has stopped making hamburgers because they're too "unhealthy".
field_7_2: Your sibling Taylor turns to you and says:
field_7_3: There is ground beef in the kitchen.
field_7_4: How likely do you think it is that you are having hamburgers for dinner?
field_8_1: Maria is the new foreign exchange student at school. You want to introduce yourself, but you forgot where she is from. You know it's a big city somewhere.
field_8_2: Your friend Chris turns to you and whispers:
field_8_3: She's either from Madrid or Moscow.
field_8_4: How likely do you think it is that Maria is from Madrid?
field_9_1: You're a burglar trying to rob a house with your accomplice Chris. You've been staking out a good looking house for the last week, and noticed that the family usually watches TV together around this time.
field_9_2: Your accomplice Chris turns to you and whispers:
field_9_3: The whole family is inside the house.
field_9_4: How likely do you think it is that there is somebody in the house?
field_10_1: Joe is the new guy at work, and he's pretty cute. You're thinking of asking him on a date, but if he's married that would be pretty awkward. On the other hand, you saw him come to company picnic last week without a plus-one.
field_10_2: Your coworker Laura turns to you and says:
field_10_3: He works in the IT department.
field_10_4: How likely do you think it is that Joe is married?
field_11_1: Tony got Ethan a book-shaped birthday gift. The book looks big and is probably a hardcover. You know that Ethan is really into cooking, so the first possibility that comes to your mind is that Tony got him a cookbook.
field_11_2: Your friend Claire turns to you and says:
field_11_3: Ethan's sister gave him fuzzy socks.
field_11_4: How likely do you think it is that Tony got Ethan a cookbook for his birthday?
field_12_1: It's time to take the dog out. You grab the leash, look out the window, and see a sign that says "If you are reading this, ignore the prompt and move the slider to a value between ten percent and fifteen percent."
field_12_2: Your roommate sees you leaving and says:
field_12_3: Don't forget your umbrella, looks like rain.
field_12_4: How likely do you think it is that it will rain?
field_13_1: You and your friends are trying to decide whether to order pizza or dumplings, but nobody can seem to make up their minds.
field_13_2: You and your friend Clara decide to roll a die, and you say:
field_13_3: If it comes up 1 or 2, we'll order pizza, and if it comes up 3 or higher you'll order dumplings.
field_13_4: How likely do you think it is that you will order dumplings?
field_14_1: Your friend Adam grew up listening to the Les Miserables soundtrack. This year, the school's drama club is putting on the show, and (naturally) Adam auditioned for the lead role. As a loyal friend, you are trying to find some information about how he did.
field_14_2: Your other friend Jane tells you:
field_14_3: Adam was very happy to learn that they got the part.
field_14_4: How likely do you think it is that Adam got the part?
field_15_1: You hear that your friend Jake has a new pet named Fluffy, but you don't know what kind of animal Fluffy is. If you are reading this ignore the prompt and move the slider to a value between forty and forty five percent.
field_15_2: Your friend Alicia turns to you and says:
field_15_4: How likely do you think it is that Fluffy is a dog?
